column1: text

The use of code embeddings and transformers significantly impacts AI-assisted programming tasks, yet a comprehensive analysis and comparison of their capabilities and limitations within this field remains underdeveloped.

AI model integration within embedded IIoT systems presents significant opportunities for optimizing industrial processes and enhancing operational efficiency through applications like fault prediction, process optimization, and predictive maintenance.

An AI-powered IoT system utilizing edge computing enables real-time, remote monitoring of cardiovascular patients, improving health outcomes and potentially saving lives through continuous data analysis and immediate alerts.

Integrating ethicists and developers collaboratively throughout the AI development process, specifically through an "embedded ethics" approach, is crucial for robustly addressing ethical concerns in medical AI.

A multi-core controller is proposed to enable flexible and efficient federated learning within resource-constrained embedded AI systems, mitigating network bandwidth issues and enhancing data security.
AI systems can embody values through intentional design activities that embed those values within the system's technical artifacts, human agents, institutions, and governing norms.

Embedded AI vision systems are evolving towards in-sensor processing to overcome cloud-based limitations, offering improved real-time performance, energy efficiency, and reduced latency through direct computation within the sensor itself.

A customized YOLOv3-tiny model deployed on low-power embedded hardware enables real-time, accurate apple detection in orchards, offering a practical solution for yield estimation and automated farm management.

AI security and functional safety engineering is crucial for embedded automotive systems, particularly concerning adversarial attacks and resource constraints, requiring specific recommendations and leveraging AI edge processing to mitigate risks.

An AI-powered ventilation KPI, utilizing embedded IoT sensors and AI models, can accurately estimate occupancy and CO2 levels in enclosed spaces, enabling improved decision-making and well-being monitoring in smart university environments.
The Intellino processor is a low-power, hardware-optimized AI processor designed to enable efficient and accurate AI operation at the edge of IoT devices by minimizing system core workload.

Embedded MCU micro-systems, leveraging embedded flash memory, are crucial for innovating edge computing within IoT and AI, driving data supply innovation and necessitating a technology roadmap for IoT applications.

Efficient embedded LSTM fall-detection algorithms can be achieved through a memory occupancy model and quantization techniques, enabling accurate implementation on wearable sensors with limited resources.
YOLO-ResTinyECG is a lightweight, embedded AI model for real-time arrhythmia detection in ECG images, achieving high accuracy and efficiency through optimized architecture and pruning methods.

An AI-powered, TinyML-based edge device solution achieves high accuracy in detecting oral tongue lesions, offering a cost-effective and automated prescreening method compared to traditional approaches.

Dynamic algorithm selection, leveraging a meta-algorithm based on reward and sample efficiency, offers a robust and adaptable solution for Virtual Network Embedding, optimizing performance and acceptance rates across diverse network scenarios.

TurbNet sensors, utilizing embedded edge AI processing of laser-beacon scintillation patterns, provide accurate in-situ characterization of atmospheric turbulence strength (C-n(2)) with high temporal resolution, achieving significant correlation with traditional scintillometer measurements.

Embedding AI ethics into the design and deployment of computer vision technology in the retail sector is crucial for mitigating bias, enhancing explainability, and ensuring technically and ethically robust AI systems that promote fair and trustworthy consumer behavior understanding.

Traditional automotive incumbents primarily utilize AI-embedded systems for knowledge exploitation during the industrialization of new vehicle development, despite the potential for big data and AI to foster more technologically original innovation.
HistoTrust leverages secure hardware and blockchain to provide verifiable traceability and explainability of AI behavior, particularly within embedded neural networks.
CMOS-compatible embedded artificial synaptic devices enable efficient and reliable neural network integration for AI applications by providing adjustable synaptic weights.

Management mathematics has a critical window of opportunity to proactively shape the development and implementation of generative AI, ensuring its future aligns with ethical considerations and human well-being before technological norms become fixed.

Accelerating AI adoption in science requires a framework of open data science interventions—including supply chain development, rapid technology transfer, AI tool creation, and effective data stewardship—to unlock AI's transformative potential across scientific disciplines.

AIfES is a next-generation edge AI framework designed to overcome limitations of existing frameworks by offering improved flexibility, hardware accelerator integration, and reduced resource consumption for on-device machine learning training, particularly for CNNs and FCNNs on resource-constrained devices.
Cognitive sensor systems, incorporating AI and trusted AI, are essential for creating a comprehensive data ecosystem and enabling the validation and qualification of NDE 4.0 inspection systems.

UCA-EHAR is a novel dataset and associated AI system (residual neural network with MicroAI deployment) designed for live, wearable human activity recognition using smart glasses, addressing the scarcity of such data and enabling practical applications in elderly care.
Interdisciplinary collaboration integrating ethics and social science is crucial for establishing best practices in the embedded ethics of AI and robotics development.

Institutional epistemic trust is crucial for the responsible development and implementation of AI in healthcare, dependent on AI practices' reliability, stakeholder knowledge, impact on professional duties, and alignment with public values.

A type-constrained, hybrid attention-based link prediction model (TC-THA) effectively reuses AI chip design knowledge by leveraging a knowledge graph to improve open-world link prediction and achieve superior performance in ACDK reuse.

CyberCortex.AI is a decentralized robotics OS facilitating collaborative AI-driven robotics by enabling real-time data streaming and distributed computation between robots and high-performance computers for AI training and deployment.
The number of inequivalent 1-embeddings of an optimal 1-embedded graph on the projective plane with a bipartite quadrangular subgraph is at most 24.
AI-based real-time gesture recognition, integrated with an embedded system, can effectively enhance and personalize English major teaching through interactive human-computer interaction.

The development of efficient AI algorithms, specifically utilizing embedded digital image processing and artificial neural networks, is crucial for addressing complex engineering challenges, particularly in resource-constrained applications like lighting control, and for optimizing power consumption.

AI-enhanced instruction, specifically the integration of intelligent tutoring agents, effectively replicates and surpasses the performance of traditional AI education, demonstrating its potential for scalable learning.
The paper derives a closed formula for the total embedding distribution of circular ladder graphs.

An embedded system utilizing a low-power sensing system with onboard AI (specifically an LSTM neural network) enables continuous, autonomous plant growth monitoring and prediction in agricultural settings.
An embedded AI system utilizing background subtraction, HOG, and SVM with occlusion handling achieves real-time vehicle classification and counting on a Raspberry Pi, meeting performance criteria.

Responsible AI systems require an ecosystem-level approach that considers the socio-technical nature of intelligent systems and introduces the concept of meta-responsibility to guide the design and development of these systems.

The SD-WEAT, a modified version of the WEAT, offers a more robust and reliable method for measuring bias in language model input embeddings, addressing limitations of the original WEAT and improving its applicability across diverse domains.

The ASimOV framework provides an end-to-end pipeline for simulating and optimizing k-NN algorithms, generating Verilog HDL code for an FPGA-based accelerator to enable efficient execution of AI algorithms within embedded systems.

Designing intelligent embedded systems that integrate artificial intelligence presents significant design challenges due to the need for resource-constrained software alongside sophisticated AI models, necessitating hardware support for effective integration.

Deep learning object detection models require adaptation and quantization for efficient execution on embedded devices, and a benchmark procedure is presented to evaluate these adaptations and assess their impact on performance.

This paper presents a hybrid AI/CV system on the Intel Myriad X VPU to enable real-time satellite pose tracking, leveraging its neural compute engine and vector processors for efficient acceleration of a ResNet-50 based UrsoNet network.

WETA is an AI method that automatically aligns taxonomic hierarchies using word embeddings, offering a practical and reproducible solution for reducing human effort and improving transparency in taxonomy mapping, particularly for national labor taxonomies.
FPGA-based deployment of CNN models offers superior performance compared to TPUs for environmental sound recognition in resource-constrained embedded systems.

Neural network pruning, particularly through specialization via transfer learning, enables efficient deployment of large pre-trained networks on resource-constrained edge devices by optimizing network size and focusing on specific target tasks.

AI readiness in Vietnam's healthcare is hindered by a combination of insufficient socio-political commitment, underdeveloped information infrastructure, and prevalent psycho-cultural barriers, impeding the transition to an AI-powered system.
MemoryRepository enhances AI NPCs by providing a long-term memory and human-like forgetting/summarization mechanism, enabling more realistic and sustained interactions.

REINVENT 4 is an open-source AI framework utilizing generative models (RNNs and Transformers) to facilitate de novo molecular design and optimization, aiming to promote transparency, innovation, and collaboration in AI-driven drug discovery.

Green AI research is increasingly focused on integrating ethical and environmental considerations into AI development to align with Sustainable Development Goals and drive responsible innovation across key areas like energy optimization, data analysis, and societal impact.

Wearable edge AI systems offer a viable and effective solution for ecological environment monitoring and analysis, demonstrated through a case study achieving high accuracy in diseased leaf classification and disease epicenter detection.

The design of a microkernel-based embedded AI engine for dual-core processors requires a systematic kernel design focusing on core modifications to leverage the processor's architecture and ensure optimal performance and security.

AI technologies deployed within critical infrastructures pose a democratic challenge due to their collective-binding effects, necessitating a sociotechnical approach to ensure democratic legitimacy and safeguard citizen influence.

Nengo tools and libraries facilitate rapid development and deployment of spiking neural networks for robust, embedded neurorobotics by addressing key challenges in robotic perception, control, and hardware compilation.

Adaptive Feature Weight Genetic Explanation (AFWGE) provides a novel and effective approach to generating counterfactual explanations for AI models by utilizing a genetic algorithm with adaptive feature weights, leading to superior explanations and valuable insights into feature importance.
KG embedding models should incorporate entity type properties in the relational context to improve performance and capture the nuanced relationships between entities and relations.

AI-CTO leverages a knowledge graph and graph embedding to automatically suggest software stack solutions, drawing upon the expertise of experienced architects to overcome knowledge barriers and improve the efficiency of software architecture design.
ReRAM-based computing-in-memory macro designs with serial input and margin-aware sense amplification enable energy-efficient 2-bit MAC operations for AI edge processors.

Applied AI ethics approaches struggle with a theory-practice gap, and a meta-framework incorporating dimensions of affects, normative justification, and governance is needed to critically assess and bridge this gap by reflecting on vulnerabilities, justifying ethical principles, and revealing power structures within AI development.
An AI-enabled embedded system dynamics model effectively simulates and optimizes system performance, demonstrating its utility for understanding and improving these systems.

Generalized translation-based knowledge graph embedding (KGLG) addresses the limitations of TransE by utilizing Lie groups for embedding and a weighted negative sampling method, resulting in improved scalability, speed, and performance on link prediction tasks.

Deploying artificial intelligence on resource-constrained embedded devices requires innovative methods like model compression and hardware acceleration to address energy consumption and compatibility challenges.
Combining knowledge graph embeddings with first-order logic rules improves recommendation accuracy and novelty by integrating deep learning with symbolic reasoning.

Normalization Process Theory can provide a framework for understanding and sustaining the standardization and integration of Generative AI-driven Optimization Intelligence within organizational contexts.
A real-time embedded system utilizing acoustic data and a convolutional neural network enables accurate and systematic classification of road surface quality for pavement monitoring.
AI techniques can improve the computational efficiency and effectiveness of virtual network embedding algorithms, specifically in cost-aware VNE problems.

An unsupervised framework is proposed to evaluate and rank structural graph embeddings, providing explainability and insights into their learned properties, addressing the lack of such a framework currently available.

Automated transformation of neural networks into Temporal Decision Early Exit models enables efficient, low-latency inference in resource-constrained embedded systems by dynamically adapting to temporal patterns in streaming data.

Physicians need to develop new competencies and responsibilities regarding the implementation and use of medical AI, extending beyond design considerations to encompass ongoing monitoring and understanding of the technology's limitations.
A scalable attribute-aware network embedding method is proposed to efficiently learn joint embeddings from network topology and node attributes, enabling dynamic updates for evolving networks.
Combining soft sensors with embedded machine learning models is crucial for overcoming signal instability and achieving accurate, versatile data analysis in wearable applications.

Neurosymbolic AI offers a promising approach to reasoning over knowledge graphs by integrating deep learning (GNNs) with symbolic reasoning, and recent research is focused on developing taxonomies and methods to bridge the gap between these approaches for improved interpretability and performance.
The optimal strategy for embedding a hypercube into a Cartesian product of paths and/or cycles is Gray code embedding, achieving the minimum wirelength.
Generative AI chatbots can effectively simplify the analysis of complex energy IoT data streams, enabling optimized grid operations and contributing to net-zero carbon emissions.

AI-based adaptive filtering, implemented on-edge using embedded systems, offers a superior and more accurate alternative to traditional DSPs for EMG signal processing, particularly when signal characteristics deviate from LTI assumptions.

A mixed SRAM and eDRAM cell design offers superior area and energy efficiency for AI memory by strategically balancing the strengths of both technologies, resulting in significant performance improvements over traditional SRAM.

Dine enhances the interpretability of existing node embeddings by providing human-understandable explanations of latent space dimensions, enabling faithful mapping to graph sub-structures and improving both interpretability and performance in graph learning tasks.
A new Neighbor Embedding method, utilizing a generalized Kullback-Leibler divergence and stochastic optimization, consistently improves cluster visualization compared to existing methods like SNE.

An edge AI UAV system utilizing hyperspectral imaging and FPGA technology achieves accurate and efficient air quality monitoring through self-adaptivity, enhancing both performance and energy efficiency.

Embedded intelligence deployments across cloud servers and edge devices for IoT applications present distinct objectives, models, and research challenges requiring a comprehensive evaluation and understanding across system, algorithm, architecture, and technology levels.
An AI-powered chatbot utilizing ChatGPT can provide accurate and timely medical information to cancer patients.

A brain-machine interactive neuromodulation tool utilizing edge AI computing enables real-time, closed-loop neuromodulation for accelerating translational research and personalized treatment of neurological and psychiatric diseases.
AI-based educational tools can effectively support the implementation of climate neutrality policies within smart cities by shaping pro-environmental behaviors and enhancing urban resilience.
An ultra-low-power embedded system utilizing a lightweight YOLOv5 model achieves accurate and efficient fire detection and crowd counting in indoor environments.

This paper provides an explicit and symmetric Taylor expansion of the canonical complex structure associated with maximal totally real embeddings, offering a geometric characterization and a potential tool for studying the moduli space of these embeddings.

AI technologies can facilitate deep conceptual learning and student flourishing through rich, socio-collaborative learning experiences, requiring a participatory design approach involving educators and diverse community members.
Algorithmic resignation – embedding governance directly into AI systems – offers a strategic method to balance automation with human oversight.

A convolutional neural network for speech recognition, incorporating a negative branch method and out-of-distribution detection, improves anomaly detection performance by maintaining high confidence for in-distribution speech while accurately identifying anomalous inputs.
Multi-objective search effectively balances reducing gender bias and improving semantic correctness in word embeddings, surpassing single-objective approaches and state-of-the-art techniques.

D-SNEQ, a differentiable quantization method, effectively compresses network embeddings while preserving high-order information, leading to improved performance and efficiency in network analytics tasks.

Combining Universal Sentence Encoder and Word2Vec embeddings enhances XSS attack detection by providing a comprehensive feature representation that captures both fine-grained word meanings and broader sentence contexts, leading to improved model performance.

Mitigating cultural bias in generative AI requires a combined approach of technical interventions and a reflexive engagement with the cultural contexts of AI development to ensure equitable representation and address the potential for biased outputs.

Evolving node embeddings are necessary to accurately represent and analyze dynamic networks, and a biased random walk method (EVNE) effectively captures network evolution by incorporating historical information for improved node representations and downstream task performance.

DimSim provides a fast and accurate network embedding framework for streaming data by incorporating discriminative modeling and efficiently approximating batch learning, enabling effective learning from evolving network snapshots.
Edge-AI enables significant energy reduction in human activity recognition on resource-constrained IoT devices compared to cloud-based AI, without sacrificing classification accuracy.

A theoretically grounded graph summarization method, HCSumm, effectively preserves node embeddings by approximating matrix factorization techniques, outperforming existing methods in preserving structural information.
Embeddings are increasingly utilized in visual analytics, and this paper provides a comprehensive survey of their methods, applications, and research trends within the field.
AI models can significantly enhance smart home design and functionality, optimizing energy efficiency and improving the user experience within living spaces.

Generative AI, specifically LLMs like GPT-4o, can effectively enrich document representations during indexing, addressing the information-poor nature of short documents and improving information retrieval efficiency.

An AI-powered embedded monitoring system, incorporating pattern recognition, significantly improves the accuracy and efficiency of online drug component recognition and teaching, addressing data loss issues and enhancing overall system effectiveness.
Neural Networks can be successfully embedded and utilized in computationally constrained industrial devices through a case study load classification task, revealing both potential and limitations.

Specialized pre-training of compact LLMs using contrastive learning techniques significantly improves healthcare-specific document classification performance compared to general-purpose models, offering a viable solution for responsible and efficient NLP deployment in resource-constrained healthcare settings.

Generative AI holds transformative potential for education by enabling personalized, immersive learning experiences through content generation, adaptive learning systems, and human-AI collaboration, while simultaneously presenting challenges related to data privacy, bias, and accountability.

Graph Neural Networks, specifically Interaction Networks, provide a novel and effective approach to contextual embedding and interaction modeling within tabular data for Deep Learning, achieving superior performance compared to traditional benchmarks.
Modern edge AI systems face challenges in deploying neural networks due to computational, energy, and memory constraints, necessitating innovative hardware/software co-design solutions.

AI-technology-based indoor environmental quality significantly impacts occupants’ productivity, primarily through its influence on their psychological and physiological health, particularly within the hospitality industry.

Analyzing edge computing devices with deployed AI algorithms, particularly considering the impact of accelerators like TPUs, to optimize performance and device selection for real-time data analysis and autonomous decision-making.

KGE performance is limited by the compositional closure of relation embeddings, and HolmE's design addresses this limitation by ensuring a closed embedding space, enabling effective modeling of under-represented composition patterns.

Discrete network embeddings (DNE and DDANE) offer a more compact and efficient representation of node networks for classification, achieving comparable accuracy while reducing storage and computational complexity.
Deep learning inference is enabling intelligent consumer devices through edge AI, reducing latency, enhancing privacy, and expanding applications across various consumer contexts.

AI-enhanced metal components, created through laser powder bed fusion and incorporating embedded sensors, can autonomously detect and analyze structural anomalies and deformations in real-time for improved mechanical component performance and connectivity.

LogicENN, a neural embedding model, effectively incorporates logical rules into knowledge graph embeddings to improve link prediction performance, demonstrating the ability to learn all encoded rule truths.

A necessary and sufficient condition for the compact embedding of Sobolev spaces in unbounded domains allows for the determination of embedding properties and the existence of solutions to semilinear elliptic equations within those domains.
An AI-assisted wearable posture recognition system (WMHPR) significantly improves accuracy and reliability compared to traditional methods, offering a robust solution for healthcare IoT applications.

A convolutional neural network optimized for polyp detection can be efficiently implemented on an embedded device, offering a viable hardware solution for real-time, accurate, and low-power cancer diagnosis.

METransE improves knowledge graph reasoning by introducing a type-aware, manifold-like mechanism to better capture and utilize hidden KG semantics, leading to more interpretable and effective reasoning.

The paper introduces a novel Engine-GAN (E-GAN) model that enables real-time, controllable generation and editing of AI-generated videos by integrating an embedded simulation engine with GAN technology.

Deep learning analysis of Weibo text data is effective for identifying and clustering public sentiment regarding AI Art, offering insights into online debates and supporting its sustainable development.

The brain’s reliance on regulatory feedback for learning, distinct from AI’s trial-and-error algorithms like backpropagation and rehearsal, offers crucial insights for advancing both neuroscience and artificial intelligence.
Artificial intelligence-based pulse waveform prediction accelerates closed-loop laser pulse shaping, enabling improved efficiency through seamless integration with existing control systems.

Label embedding effectively addresses image classification, particularly in zero-shot learning, by representing classes as embeddings within a space of attribute vectors, enabling parameter sharing and improved ranking of relevant classes.

Early patient and public involvement is crucial for successful AI integration into healthcare, ensuring acceptance, addressing potential challenges, and maximizing the impact of AI on patient outcomes.
Lightweight AI orchestration at the edge of low-voltage distribution networks enhances resource utilization, reduces cloud computing pressure, and improves application processing time.
LExCI is a framework that enables reinforcement learning agent training on embedded systems by bridging the gap between conventional RL libraries and the specific requirements of these devices.

ICANE, a deep learning model integrating network structure and resource content, effectively learns network representations and improves resource discovery performance through hierarchical aggregation and semantic proximity search.

A Neural Network-based Discrete Element Method (NN4DEM) offers a GPU-accelerated approach to computationally intensive DEM simulations by transforming particle interactions into convolutional operations, eliminating the need for training data and enabling scalability to large 3D models.
Embedded AI enables real-time decision-making and enhanced efficiency by integrating AI directly into devices.
Learning embeddings with triple trustiness effectively addresses noise in knowledge graphs, leading to improved embedding quality compared to traditional approaches.
Hybrid AI methods, utilizing IoT sensors and artificial neural networks, provide highly effective frost forecasting and automated anti-disaster irrigation control in greenhouses.

A low-cost, end-to-end brain-robot interaction system utilizing personalized BiLSTM learning with an attention mechanism enables individuals, particularly the elderly, to control robots through EEG signals for domestic tasks.

CW-GCN enhances cross-graph embedding robustness by leveraging correntropy-induced loss for noise reduction and Wasserstein distance minimization to reliably transfer knowledge from a noisy source graph to a target graph.

A semantic embedding-based heterogeneous network approach effectively models online learners by integrating multidimensional learner characteristics and contextual information, enhancing performance in both course recommendation and learner clustering tasks.
The paper proposes an AI-powered student information management system utilizing fingerprint recognition to enhance data security and provide timely information for organizational decision-making.
A pairwise-interaction differentiated embeddings model effectively learns entity and relation representations to improve knowledge base completion by predicting the likelihood of new factual triples.
Semi-supervised deep embedded clustering with pairwise constraints improves clustering performance by incorporating prior knowledge to learn feature representations that enforce cluster separation.

SketchNE provides a memory-efficient and scalable network embedding solution utilizing a sparse-sign randomized SVD algorithm, achieving superior performance and efficiency compared to existing methods on large networks.

AI Wings is a cloud-based AIoT drone system that enables secure command and control of multiple UAVs, facilitates AI model deployment and training through VR simulation, and supports automated drone services.

A hybrid deep learning model incorporating FastText embeddings and a CNN-LSTM architecture, alongside transformer-based models and explainable AI techniques, achieves superior fake news detection accuracy by effectively leveraging multimedia elements, semantic understanding, and model interpretability.

DMEAG, a deep manifold embedding framework, effectively preserves graph structure and attributes by directly imposing constraints on the latent space, leading to superior performance in graph embedding and downstream tasks.
Learning semantic and structural representations through ontology embeddings significantly improves ontology alignment performance compared to traditional methods.
DualTaxoVec learns user embeddings and automatically generates a domain-specific taxonomy from user interaction data to improve user analysis and clustering.

A novel knowledge graph embedding model, StructurE, achieves state-of-the-art link prediction results by incorporating relational and edge structure-context information, alongside relation-type-specific scoring, to effectively model complex graph structures.
Neuromorphic processing chips (specifically the NM500) offer superior energy efficiency for machine learning tasks in embedded systems compared to CPUs and GPUs.

The text-embedding-ada-002 (ADA) model demonstrates superior accuracy in detecting childbirth-related post-traumatic stress disorder (CB-PTSD) from maternal birth narratives compared to ChatGPT and other established models, offering a promising approach for screening this undiagnosed maternal mental illness.
Simple, non-convex ordinal embedding algorithms consistently outperform more complex algorithms across various tasks and data sizes due to their resistance to local optima.
O-RAN architecture leverages Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to enable disaggregated, intelligent resource allocation and optimize future wireless network deployments.

Receiver-embedded generative AI enables super-personalized media experiences by dynamically generating content on-demand from semantic sources, shifting content creation from the provider to the receiver to combat content fatigue and enhance diversity.

Engineers' imaginaries of healthcare significantly shape the design and development of AI and robotics applications, necessitating an analysis of these imaginaries to address ethical and social considerations within healthcare technology.
A convolutional recurrent neural network trained on electromyography signals enables real-time, accurate dynamic hand gesture recognition for industrial robot control via an edge AI platform.
Reconstructing pre-trained word embeddings using subword information enables efficient memory management, addresses out-of-vocabulary words, and maintains embedding quality for downstream tasks.

AI-based transcriptions, particularly those utilizing Wav2Vec enhanced audio, demonstrate high accuracy in detecting Alzheimer's disease from speech data, highlighting the potential of NLP and GPT embeddings for automatic detection but revealing a critical need for more training data to effectively classify prodromal stages like MCI.

AI providers strategically adapt and employ practices like stealth science, agility, and digital ambidexterity to navigate the complex and unpredictable diffusion of AI-enabled diagnostics within variable healthcare systems.
AI-related anxiety among metro drivers negatively impacts safety performance through job insecurity and thriving at work, with the strength of HR systems moderating this relationship.
Word embedding-based methods are the most effective approach for automatically assigning movie microgenres, outperforming clustering and topic modeling and offering a fully automated solution.

Generative AI, specifically a Refined CVAE model, can synthesize comprehensive lithium battery charging data in real-time based on battery state conditions (EOL and ECL), overcoming limitations of traditional data generation methods and enabling improved battery performance prediction.

A novel, transferable discrete network embedding method addresses both knowledge transfer and non-differentiable discretization, achieving superior performance across various network tasks compared to conventional methods.
Real-time emotion recognition using lightweight AI models on embedded devices enhances classroom teaching effectiveness by providing teachers with immediate feedback on student learning status.

A novel framework utilizing lightweight machine learning for anomaly and malfunction detection provides effective, proactive maintenance and resource optimization for low-power embedded IoT systems, demonstrably improving fault tolerance and system reliability.
Edge embedding, when performed using SGNS and leveraging spectral theory, dramatically outperforms node embedding in multi-label classification tasks due to its equivalence to line graph embedding.

Graph Neural Networks can effectively enable multi-modal causability and information fusion, facilitating explainable AI by leveraging knowledge graphs to construct robust, less biased machine learning models that learn from fewer data.

A multimodal interaction-aware embedding framework leveraging contrastive learning improves entity representations in heterogeneous location-based social networks for enhanced point-of-interest recommendation.

Efficient embedding and near-neighbor searching in hyperbolic spaces can be achieved through a discrete metric space construction with logarithmic distortion, enabling scalable graph-based representations and approximate Voronoi diagrams.

A dual-core microcontroller architecture, specifically utilizing the STM32H747, dramatically improves AI inference efficiency in embedded systems, achieving up to 6x faster data processing and 30% increased processing efficiency compared to single-core systems.

Acoustic word embeddings improve end-to-end speech synthesis naturalness by jointly training acoustic and word embeddings, surpassing both pure phone-based systems and those using pre-trained linguistic word embeddings.
Embedding neural networks into mobile IoT systems enhances usability and feasibility for intelligent, autonomous device interactions and service provision.
An explicit-reflective online learning module significantly enhances science and engineering students’ ethical awareness and problem-solving skills concerning AI ethics.
Every completely regular ordered space is order embedded in the Tychonoff ordered cube of infinite weight of that space.
A wearable Smart Hat device utilizing IoT and AI technologies is designed to enable independent, active, and engaging object recognition learning for children.

A linear, optimal transport-embedded neural network with data augmentation effectively addresses fairness transfer learning by aligning source and target distributions, improving performance in low-power edge AI applications.
An edge-AI-based ALPR system utilizing YOLOv4-Tiny and a modified YOLOv4 model on an embedded AGX system achieves high, real-time license plate recognition accuracy with low computational cost.

Embedding-based topic analysis, utilizing word and document embeddings, provides a superior method for identifying and quantifying scientific evolutionary paths by capturing semantic relationships and evolutionary states, ultimately enabling improved innovation management.

YOLOv5-CS, a lightweight object detection model incorporating advanced techniques like CIoU loss and attention modules, enables accurate and efficient green citrus detection and counting within AI edge systems, facilitating real-time monitoring and management in citrus orchards.

Contextual word embeddings in personalized query expansion require a clustering-based approach to address the issue of semantic overlap and improve term diversity, overcoming the limitations of traditional word embedding methods.
PPPNE learns more informative node representations by preserving personalized proximity, addressing the limitations of existing methods that fail to capture vertex-specific information.

A container-based edge computing architecture utilizing lightweight Kubernetes (K3s) and GPU-embedded devices enables improved real-time fish detection performance and serves as a model for edge computing ecosystems.

Hybrid word embeddings, specifically a combination of trained domain-specific embeddings and dimensionality-reduced pre-trained embeddings, significantly improves CV retrieval accuracy by effectively matching job descriptions.

AI-based embedded software in Maritime Autonomous Surface Ships presents novel product liability challenges requiring legal policy adjustments to balance technological advancement with maritime safety and consumer protection.

A multi-task learning model incorporating persona awareness and leveraging a novel Emoji-embedded dialogue dataset (EmojiTweet) effectively addresses data scarcity in Emoji-embedded dialogue generation, leading to improved dialogue quality and user engagement.

Account identity-based uncertain graphs, incorporating multifactor identity modeling and community detection, offer a superior method for detecting malicious account communities involved in online fraud, addressing the limitations of single-factor identity approaches.
Neural network prediction methods demonstrate superior effectiveness in stock market forecasting compared to other approaches, achieving a minimum training rate of approximately 0.9.

User biases and their influence on AI/ML tool reliance pose a significant challenge to fair and transparent healthcare AI implementation, necessitating design interventions to promote critical user decision-making.
Hardware-level micro AI, utilizing Hardware Performance Counters, provides an accurate and efficient countermeasure against malware and side-channel attacks on resource-constrained edge devices.
Kernel and neural embeddings improve both the optimization and generalization of deeper neural networks by aligning data representations with target labels.
Projection word embeddings, when combined with LSTM, outperform BERT in automatically scoring medical records, offering improved accuracy compared to other architectures.
EG-STC, a secure two-party computation framework utilizing embedded GPUs, offers an efficient and accelerated solution for privacy-preserving machine learning on resource-constrained AI systems.
GEnI is a framework that generates explanations and insights for knowledge graph embedding models, specifically by producing rules, correlations, and influence detections in natural language.
Intelligent Fuzzy Clustering (specifically HE-IFCM) enables high-capacity watermark embedding in 3D models, achieving significant data storage while minimizing distortion.

Knowledge graph embedding and a custom deep neural network (KGDNN) significantly improve adverse drug reaction prediction accuracy compared to existing methods, utilizing a constructed knowledge graph with diverse entities.

A lightweight CNN hardware accelerator, specifically designed for depthwise convolutions, offers an efficient solution for running computationally intensive CNNs—particularly MobileNet—on edge devices, enabling AI at the edge.
RG-DEVS extends DEVS models with intelligent planning capability through a goal regression method, dynamically generating sequential states and action plans for corrective actions.
AI-enhanced dynamic authentication, leveraging adaptive block creation and verification, provides a more secure and efficient blockchain consensus mechanism for IoMT-edge eHealth applications.

A novel CNN compression framework, combining pruning, knowledge distillation, and adversarial training, effectively enhances the adversarial robustness of compressed CNNs for security-sensitive embedded systems.

Multi-channel word embeddings, incorporating attention mechanisms and deep learning models, significantly improve sentiment analysis performance by enhancing word representation and focused information extraction.

Click-based deep embeddings with visual attention and query semantic embedding effectively mitigate the limitations of text-based and human-labeled image ranking methods for image search, achieving superior performance through end-to-end training on click data.

XAI-HAR, a novel approach utilizing explainable AI and sensor data, achieves superior performance in cognitive health assessment (specifically, health and dementia classification and activity recognition) by identifying and weighting key features, ultimately enhancing the interpretability and accuracy of AI-driven decision-making.

Software-intensive embedded systems companies must strategically adapt their ecosystems – integrating software, data, and AI alongside existing technologies – to successfully navigate the transformative impact of digitalization and maintain competitiveness.

Transferring knowledge learned from one network to another is crucial for accelerating the adoption of AI-based traffic analysis solutions, particularly due to the scarcity of labeled data and dynamic networking environments.

InversEF, a knowledge graph embedding model utilizing inverse function representation, effectively addresses the limitations of existing models in handling symmetric relations for improved link prediction performance.

Strategic technology management, particularly for public interest technologies, requires a dynamic balancing of techno-centric and human-centric approaches, facilitated by the Quintuple Innovation Helix plus AI methodology to address the complexities of Industry 6.0 and Society 6.0.

Overlay-ML efficiently enables on-device deep learning by combining limited memory with underlying storage space and providing data transparency to mitigate unexpected OS termination and achieve optimal model performance.

Automatic information extraction from AI chip domain literature using the GIA-PME model improves entity recognition accuracy and efficiency, addressing the information overload faced by AI chip researchers.

A contrastive learning framework utilizing a compact gesture embedding effectively enables fine-grained few-shot static gesture recognition by accurately representing subtle variations in hand gestures.
AI technical debt significantly impacts the quality and maintainability of AI-enabled systems, yet practitioners lack sufficient tools and understanding to effectively manage it.

Contextualized word embeddings, particularly ELMo, significantly improve spam detection accuracy on social media platforms by capturing nuanced semantic signals, enabling more effective personalized deep learning models for combating evolving threats.

A convex embedding technique, utilizing a Lyapunov function and linear matrix inequalities, provides a method for designing homogeneous finite-time controllers for nonlinear systems, guaranteeing stability through a parallel distributed compensation approach.

QIQE-KGC, a knowledge graph completion method utilizing quantum embedding and quaternion interaction, significantly improves KG completion accuracy by effectively modeling complex logical relationships within triples and between entities and relations.

A hybrid AI model incorporating improved susceptible-infected modeling and natural language processing significantly enhances COVID-19 prediction accuracy by accounting for individual infection rate variations and the impact of prevention measures.

A convolutional feature extractor combined with an edge AI processor effectively accelerates strawberry ripeness classification by reducing computational burden and memory overhead, enabling feasibility in embedded environments.

Leveraging pre-trained language models to incorporate textual knowledge into knowledge graph embedding models improves their accuracy by guiding the learning process and enhancing triple plausibility assessment.

Sentence embedding should prioritize semantic coherence by positioning similar sentences close together in an embedding space, as demonstrated by the superior performance of the proposed Paraphrase-Thought model.

A new machine learning framework is designed and evaluated for resource-constrained embedded IoT devices, enabling real-time, autonomous decision-making through lightweight machine learning algorithms.

REACT! is an interactive educational tool designed to facilitate student learning of AI planning for robotics by providing a user-friendly interface for representing complex, dynamic domains and solving planning problems involving concurrency, geometric reasoning, and temporal goals.

Multidimensional scaling and cluster analysis can effectively identify and track hierarchy, (dis)integration levels, and temporal changes in the integration of global stock markets.

Robots can effectively promote health behaviors at the workplace by leveraging the Health Action Process Approach, particularly through influencing behavioral intentions and translating them into volitional outcomes.

Hf-Nb alloy anodic memristors with mixed oxide structures exhibit improved memristive switching behavior and multi-level resistance states, offering a promising pathway for high-density in-memory computing systems.

Transition metal alloyed nanoparticles embedded in N-doped honeycombed carbon demonstrate high-efficiency bifunctional catalysis for oxygen reduction and evolution reactions, significantly enhancing the power density of Zn-air batteries.

A novel, content-based invisible image watermarking technique is proposed to detect alterations within digital documents by embedding a changeable watermark derived from text content and document structure.

Zn-doped iron oxide nanoparticles within hybrid anion exchange adsorbents significantly enhance phosphate adsorption selectivity and recovery by mediating a complex interplay of physisorption, chemisorption, and regeneration processes, particularly impacting phosphate speciation and nanoparticle stability.

Blockchain integration into IoT forensics offers a robust, scalable, and high-performance solution for preserving digital evidence, addressing key challenges in IoT investigations, and ultimately improving the efficiency and reliability of the forensics process.

MOC31 is a reliable marker for distinguishing hepatocellular carcinoma from adenocarcinoma and cholangiocarcinoma, offering superior performance compared to other commonly used immunostains.

Autologous formalin-fixed tumor vaccines demonstrate safety and feasibility in glioblastoma multiforme patients, with low p53 and high MHC class-I expression potentially predicting treatment response and improving survival outcomes.

Multicolor fluorescence techniques revealed that macrophage apoptosis is prevalent in atherosclerotic plaques, primarily within the tunica media and lipid core, and plays a role in plaque destabilization.

The SFO’s unique anatomical organization, characterized by distinct vasculature and cellular populations, critically mediates peripheral signaling and responses to humoral stimuli, particularly through the influence of angiotensin II.

Nuclear HDGF expression is a significant prognostic marker in gallbladder adenocarcinoma, associated with poorer survival outcomes and key clinical characteristics.

The Schneiderian membrane possesses regenerative potential driven by nestin-expressing progenitor cells that can induce osteogenesis and potentially involve epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) processes in maxillary sinus floor remodeling.

High LET particle irradiation induces DNA damage intensity in 3D tissue equivalents that mirrors the physical Bragg curve, reflecting a direct correlation between particle energy and DNA damage distribution.
Racial discrimination reduces neural activation in brain networks associated with processing health information, potentially hindering behavior change and contributing to health disparities.

A magnetically-actuated soft-tethered capsule colonoscope offers a minimally invasive and potentially smoother navigation alternative to conventional colonoscopy, achieving comparable polyp detection rates and demonstrating promise for colorectal cancer screening.

A genomic language model can learn functional and regulatory relationships between genes by encoding contextualized protein embeddings from metagenomic data, revealing complex co-regulated modules within genomic regions.

An electronic clinical decision support tool, integrating diarrhea etiology prediction and rehydration guidance, demonstrates feasibility and acceptability in improving diarrheal management and antibiotic stewardship in low-resource settings.

Siesta duration and associated lifestyle factors mediate the association between siestas and obesity/metabolic syndrome.
